title: President Barack Obama Announces Presidential Delegation to the Holy See to Attend a Ceremony Elevating Two American Archbishops to Cardinals | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
November 17, 2010

 



President Barack Obama Announces Presidential Delegation to the Holy See to Attend a Ceremony Elevating Two American Archbishops to Cardinals




President Barack Obama today announced the designation of a Presidential Delegation to the Holy See to attend a ceremony elevating two American Archbishops to Cardinals. On November 20-21, Pope Benedict XVI will elevate Vatican Chief Justice Archbishop Raymond Burke (formerly Archbishop of St. Louis, MO)Â  and Washington, DC Archbishop Donald Wuerl to the College of Cardinals.
The Honorable Miguel Humberto Diaz, U.S. Ambassador to the Holy See will lead the delegation.
Additional member of the Presidential Delegation:
The Honorable Daniel M. Rooney, U.S. Ambassador to Ireland
